result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Frank Helgeson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
3:43 PM Defendant Willie Frank Helgeson in court in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz.  Attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Kristian Lindo appears for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Stephanie Vasos sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Lindo, cross-exam by Atty. Boaz, exam by Court. Court finds probable cause, binds case over for trial. Atty. Boaz bail motion. State opposes motion. Court denies motion to reduce bail.  State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To modify bond filed by Atty Boaz with court date of 10/26 @ 3 pm
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Corrected time of 3:00 pm on 10/26 for Preliminary Hearing.

10:47 AM Defendant Willie Frank Helgeson in court.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Willie Frank Helgeson.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Officer unable to testify. State requesting to adjourn, no objection by Counsel.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Clerk was notified that Officer Vasos had a call and cannot appear for PH today at 11:15 am. Jail notified to put defendant on zoom, case to be called at 10:00 am time slot.

10:17 AM Defendant Willie Frank Helgeson appeared by video, in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz.  Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests a preliminary hearing, waives time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
No contact with Piggly Wiggly stores on Cedarburg Rd or Mequon Rd. Must remain at least 500 ft from those stores.

1:13 PM Defendant Willie Frank Helgeson in court by video from the Ozaukee Co Jail and by Atty. Rachel Boaz. Atty. Antonella Aleman Zientek appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant qualifies for PD. State recommends $1500 cash bail. Court orders $1000 cash bail w/conditions.
Status hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Per Dispatch, subject in custody on warrant
Copy of complaint/warrant emailed to Sheriffnotice
